author: Alexander Stoklosa
title: Listen to the 2018 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 at Laguna Seca, Sounding ’Murican as Hell [Video]
text:
-Hey, remember that Chevrolet Corvette that’s on its way for 2018, the one that’s mightier than the Z06 , the one you’ve only seen in prototype form? ( The one that’s not mid-engined !) Thanks to a couple of eagle-eyed members of the Corvette Forum blog, you can now see the Corvette ZR1 on the move—and quickly—at Mazda Raceway Laguna Seca. More important, you can hear the beastly ’Vette, and it sounds wicked. 
-The cluster of videos, posted to YouTube and later to Corvette Forum by users Skank and SBC and a Stick, show ZR1 prototypes ripping around Laguna Seca, as well as the creative possibilities of forum avatar naming. The camouflaged car, complete with a large rear wing and funky, randomly colored body panels, seems to be the same as or highly similar to the prototypes our spy photographers caught testing late last year .
- - - The 2018 Corvette Stingray ZR1 Is Going to Have Insane Aero - ZR1 and Mid-Engine C8 Corvettes Spied Together in Cold-Weather Tests - Chevrolet Corvette Z06 Research: Full Pricing, Photos, and Reviews! - - -None of the videos reveal anything we didn’t already know, but they do give us our best listen yet of what to expect from the ZR1’s supercharged V-8: lots, and lots, and lots of glorious small-block music. Check out the choicest clips below, and take comfort or fear in knowing that when the ZR1 becomes a reality, it’s expected to be a 200-plus-mph, roughly 750-hp monster.
